citation.article-title: Desulfuromonas acetexigens sp. nov., a dissimilatory sulfur-reducing eubacterium from anoxic freshwater sediments.

p.s: Description of Desulfuromonas acetexigens sp. nov.
Desulfuromonas acetexigens (A.cet.éxi.gens. L.n. acetum vinegar; Mi.n. acidum aceticum acetic acid; L.v. exigo to demand; M.L. part. adj. acetexiens demanding acetate for growth)

Cells elongated ovoid to rod-shaped, 0.9-1.2 μm wide, 1.3-3.5 μm long; Multiplication by binary fission; cells possess a single flagellum in polar or subpolar position; under most conditions only few cells motile.
Do not form spores.
Gram-negative.
Strict anaerobic chemoorganotrophs, which grow in mineral medium with 0.01-0.03% Na2S⋄9H2O as a reductant.
Isolates grow well in medium without NaCl and MgCl2⋄H2O and not at NaCl concentrations above 1%.
Biotin was required as growth factor by the type strain, additional growth factors may be required by other strains.
Acetate is used as energy and carbon source in the presence of 24 mmol/l hydrogen carbonate.
Elemental sulfur, fumarate or malate serve as electron acceptors.
pH range from 6.4-8.5; optimum pH: 7.6-7.8; cells from clumps at pH below 7.4.
Optimum growth temperature
Pigments.

Accumulations of cells in colonies or pellets appear pink to reddish; under reducing conditions cell suspensions exhibit absorption spectra characteristic for c-type cytochromes (abs. may. at 419, 523, 553 nm).
The mol% of G+C of the DNA ranges from 58.6-62.5.
The type strain 2873 has 61.2 mol% G+C (Tm).
Habitat.
Anoxic, sulfide-containing mud of freshwater environments and digester sludge of sewage treatment plants.
Type strain isolated from digester sludge of the treatment plant, Göttingen, Germany.
Type strain.
Strain 2873, DSM 1379, deposited in Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Braunschweig, Germany.
